newsitem.title: UK: ING Barings bullish on Russian debt prices.
newsitem.headline: ING Barings bullish on Russian debt prices.

text.p: The outlook for Russian debt prices looks positive, especially the old Soviet commercial debt which is near to being restructured, ING Barings said on Monday.
"We are generally bullish on Russia at current levels. This view is based on a positive assessment of political and economic risk," it said in a research comment.
A series of events, including the closing of the Vneshekonombank commercial debt deal and a Eurobond launch before the end of the year, will be positive for investor sentiment.
Set against this is the continued speculation over the health of President Boris Yeltsin and a potential succession crisis.
"But, overall, we feel that the political system has matured to the point where such shocks can be handled within the framework of the constitution," it added.
It was least optimistic about the outlook for MinFins.
"Tightening at the short end will be limited from current levels and..the long end will remain out of bounds for many foreign investors for some time to come."

When-and-if principal -- which the Vnesh debt will turn into once it is restructured -- looks attractive on pure risk-return grounds, though its high spread of around 1,200 basis points is partly due to uncertainty over custodial and accountancy procedures for the asset.

"Our most favoured asset through year-end is unrestructred Vnesh, the idea being to capture the collapse of deal risk on closing and pick up a further expected tightening in spreads in the principle and IAN (interest arrears note) instruments," it added.
"Investors could combine this with a short position in the ...(when-and-if) instruments in proportion to the face value of principle loans to the attached PDI (past-due interest).
